description: Borrowed from Latin colligatus, past participle of colligare (“to collect”).

verbs.description: colligate (third-person singular simple present colligates, present participle colligating, simple past and past participle colligated)

examples: The pieces of isinglass are colligated in rows.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To formally link or connect together logically; to bring together by colligation; to sum up in a single proposition.
examples: He had discovered and colligated a multitude of the most wonderful  […]  phenomena.
